Projects

The possibilities are endless...

We Out

Event Coordinating Mobile App

The idea came about when my team and I realized that coordinating events with friends while keeping in mind their availability was quite a hassle. With WeOut, we were able to help users categorize their friends into spheres, and invite them into a poll room where they have a few minutes to make a decision about an activity.
My team and I decided to use React-Native for our front-end. Firebase was used for our database. Firebase is a schema-less database which I found to be very challenging to learn because I was familiar with SQL and Sequelize ORM. Nevertheless, it was an exciting and fruitful challenge!

Click here to see WeOut source code

Pomme des Terre

Mock e-commerce Website

In this mock e-commerce website, the stack used was React, Express, Node, Redux, and Sequelize. Throughout this project, I was solely responsible for createing backend express routes that would allow a user to update their information. I was able to achieve this by creating Thunk middleware in my Redux store and change the component's state. The websites UI was another responsibility of mine. No external libraries were used. It was simple CSS and Flexbox.

Click here to see Pomme Des Terre source code

Pineapple

Mobile app

Ever been on a date you wish you could say a safeword and get out of? That's were PineApple comes in. Think of it as a discreet Siri. This mobile app created with React Native and Firebase, is able to listen for pre-set safewords. Say `Pikachu` and your phone will trigger a dummy call to save the day! Say `Lemons` and your phone will send your current location to your bff.

This is my current passion project which is still in development. Ask me about it!

Click here to see PineApple source code
